page.title: 08BIOGRAPHY OF MR.A.O.ELMHIRST
page.content: Mr Elmhirst was born in{1901}.His family have been major landowners in Worsbrough for at least 700 years.He comes from a large family and the children were all taught at home by a governess until the age of ten.At that age they were sent to boarding school and only met one another in the holidays.Mr Elmhirst enjoyed his time at home with his brothers and sisters they would look after rabbits and ferrits,collect caterpillars,ride bikes and go bathing.His father taught him to ride,play cricket and make fence posts.He went to school at {Winchester College},he says he was a poor scholar so bad at maths that the maths master advised him to bring a good book along to maths lessons and sit at the back.Mr Elmhirst remembers how the headmaster would read out the names of old pupils killed in the war.
